#include<stdio.h>
//#include<conio.h>
long long expo(long long base,long long power)
{
	long long result=1;
	while(power!=0)
	{
		if(power%2!=0)
		{
			result*=base;
			
		}
		base=(base*base);
		power/=2;
	}
	return result;
}
int mult(int *a,int N)
{
	
	long long i,RESULT=1,p;			//when result is,  say, 10^6, and *(a+i) is say 10^7, product cannot be stored in int, u need long long
	p=expo(10,9);
	p=p+7;
	for(i=0;i<N;i++)
	{
	RESULT=(RESULT%p)*	(*(a+i)%p);		//Use pointer like this
	RESULT=RESULT%p;
	
		}
	return RESULT;	
}
int main()
{
	int a[101],T,N,i,j,r;
	scanf("%d",&T);
	for(j=0;j<T;j++)		//i used at two places changing each other's value
	{
		scanf("%d",&N);
		for(i=0;i<N;i++)
		scanf("%d",&a[i]);
		r=mult(a,N);
		printf("%d\n",r);	//Use \n
		}
	//getch();
}
